#Text=CLEGGETT STANDS BY HIS SHIP
#Text=Cleggett did not fear ( or rather , expect , since there was very little that Cleggett feared ) an attack until well after nightfall .
#Text=Nevertheless , he began to prepare for it at once .
#Text=He called the entire ship 's company aft , with the exception of Miss Medley , who was on duty with Giuseppe Jones .

#Text=" My friends -- for I hope we stand in the relation of friends as well as that of commander and crew -- I have every reason to expect that the enemy will make a demonstration in force sometime during the night , " he said .

#Text=Speakin ' for myself , Mr. Cleggett , as the nautical commander of this here ship to the military commander , I do n't mind owning up that MY feelin 's is hurt .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Aye , aye , sir , " said George the Greek , addressing the nautical commander , and the word went from lip to lip .

column1: #Text=" Aye , aye , sir , " said Dr. Farnsworth , " the Captain speaks for us all . "
#Text=And the Reverend Mr. Calthrop remarked with a sigh : " You may have cause to doubt my circumspection , Mr. Cleggett , but you have no cause to doubt my courage . "
#Text=Cleggett was not the sort of man who is ashamed to acknowledge an error .
#Text=" Friends , " he cried impulsively , " forgive me !

#Text= Now , " said Cleggett , smiling back on the enthusiastic faces before him , but inexpressibly touched by the fineness of his crew 's devotion , " to get to the point .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Mr. Cleggett , " said Lady Agatha , rising when he had finished , and speaking with animation , " will you permit me to make a suggestion ? "

column1: #Text=She went on , without waiting for an answer :
#Text=" It is this : Choose your own ground for this battle !

#Text=At the moment you are attacked , weigh anchor , fight your way to the mouth of the canal , take up a position in the bay in front of Morris 's within easy rifle range and out of pistol shot , and compel the place to surrender on your own terms !

#Text= The Honorable Miss Englishman have hit her head on the nail !

_	_	_	_

#Text= You are right , " cried Cleggett , catching fire with the idea , " a hundred times right !

column1: #Text=" Also Honorable Admiral Togo 's veins ! "
#Text=A good breeze had sprung up out of the northwest while the conference in the cabin was in progress .
#Text=Cleggett was relieved that it was not from the south .

#Text=There is not much room to maneuver a schooner in a canal , and a breeze from the south might have sailed the Jasper B. backwards towards Parker 's Beach , which would undoubtedly have given the enemy the idea that Cleggett was retreating .
#Text=The Jasper B. ' s bow was pointed south , and Cleggett was naturally anxious that she should sail south .

#Text=At the outset a slight difficulty presented itself with regard to the anchors -- for although , as has been explained before , the Jasper B. was a remarkably stable vessel , Cleggett had had the new anchors furnished by the contractor let down .
#Text=Having the anchors down seemed , somehow , to make things more shipshape .

#Text=It appeared that no one of the adventurers was acquainted with an anchor song , and Cleggett , and , indeed , all on board , felt that these anchors should be hoisted to the accompaniment of some rousing chantey .
#Text=Lady Agatha was especially insistent on the point .
